result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Dandridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Court ordered restitution in the stipulated amount of $573.00 payable to Tiffany L- joint and several with William D. Goodrum (15CF1089).

Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
If revoked, the Court ordered all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.

Seek and maintain employment.
Participate in job and vocational training.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with victim Tiffany L., or co-actor William D. Goodrum.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens- the Court recommends revocation upon any dirty urine analysis.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center-STAYED until 7-13-15,5pm.  Defendant instructed to report to HOC.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Violation report, received and filed.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Co-actor has been arrested and charged.  Adjournment requested.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM013281  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/04/2015
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant to post an additional $250.00.  All other conditions of bail previously ordered remain.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher, who appeared by telephone.   Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was scheduled for sentencing on today's date, but the parties needed an adjournment as defense counsel had an appeance in Chicago.  However, defendant's test results came back positive for THC.  Arguments as to bail heard.  Court ordered defendant to post an additional $250.00 and warned defendant that he may not use or possess drugs.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher, who appeared by telephone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file. Defendant appeared in court and spoke with counsel before case was called on the record. Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn without processing and without service.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Defendant wishes to challenge results of finding.  Court ordered defendant to pay said fee to Justice Point on or before Monday, February 16th.  Court admonished defendant and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Case remains calendared for sentencing before Branch 20 on 3/03/15 at 8:30 a.m. Justice Point caseworker notified of same.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, State requested an adjournment of this case; defense counsel has no objection.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised that he has a case in Chicago that will take most of the morning; as Branch 20 is in trial as well, case is adjourned.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing Packet, submitted by defense counsel, received and filed.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.

Court reinstated $500.00 cash bail; $1,000.00 remains on deposit to be HELD by the Clerk of Courts for any restitution/court costs and surcharges.  Court ordered TOT to Justice Point; absolute sobriety; no alcohol; no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription; drug testing and breathalyzers; no firearms or weapons.  No Contact Order remains in effect.

Attorney Marc Efton Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court via telephone with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Jay R. Pucek appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard  for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's violation report received and provided to the State; results were read to defense counsel over the phone.  Defense counsel afforded an opportunity to speak with client out of the presence of the Court.  Arguments on bail heard.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED until sentencing.

Justice Point caseworker Mason L. contacted the court and advised that defendant never checked in by him as required after court and indicated that the defendant stated he would return tomorrow.  Court ordered defendant to appear both in Justice Point and to this court at 1:30 p.m.  This clert contacted both the State and defense counsel to secure their appearances for the afternoon.
Violation Report received and filed.  Defendant tested positive for THC.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.
Status Report from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was advised by Justice Point that defendant has paid his $25.00 as of 8/04/14, not on 7/25/14 as defendant previously indicated.  Through Justice Point protocol, defendants have ten days from the initial drop to pay for analysis.  Therefore, Court ordered all conditions of bail to continue and continued matter before Branch 20.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher, who appeared by telephone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for a bail hearing; defendant wishes to pay to challenge finding in violation report.  Court ordered defendant to pay said fee by 7/25/14 and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report, filed.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Deann L. Heard appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs offer; Branch 20 in trial.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Justice Point report received; defendant compliant.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM031310  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/21/2014

Defense is requesting modification of the bail to $1,500.00 cash.  State has no objection to a modification, but request bail be set to $2,000.00.  Court has some concerns.  Court orders $1,500.00 cash bail.

Attorney Marc E Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  State is awaiting additional evidence.  Parties stipulate to an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc E Christopher.  Defendant Michael A Dandridge in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a plea date; resolution reached; case will not proceed to trial on today's date.  Jury panel recalled. Court had colloquy with defendant regarding his right to a speedy trial as demanded and defendant advised the Court he is waiving his right to a speedy trial at this time.  Court found defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently understood his rights concerning speedy trials and waiving same on today's date.   Court granted joint request and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marc E Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is to be produced for Monday's jury trial; defendant to waive his speedy trial demand.

Attorney Marc E Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties jointly request an adjournment of Monday's speedy trial, set for 4/28/14, as a new offer was tendered and new discovery has been received.  Defense counsel wants an opportunity to go over same with his client.  The 4/28/14 date is vacated.  Case is rescheduled for final pretrial and new SPEEDY jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT'S MOTIONS IN LIMINE, FILED BY ATTORNEY MARC E. CHRISTOPHER.

Attorney Marc Efton Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody. Jay R. Pucek appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard  for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel needs an offer; case continued for final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/submitted by Attorney Christopher, filed. rn

Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Court set the following briefing schedule: defense motions due by 3/12/14; State's response due by 3/27/14; 4/01/14 is the defense reply date.  All jury instructions, witness lists and motions and limine  are due within one week prior to the final pretrial date.

Attorney Marc Christopher in court, defendant Michael A Dandridge not in court, in custody.  DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail from Attorney Marc E. Christopher.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Marc Christopher.  Defendant Michael A Dandridge in custody.  James Frisch for DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TIFFANY L. OR CO-ACTOR:  WILLIAM G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael A Dandridge in court with attorney Joan E Zawikowski.  Defendant Michael A Dandridge in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
